data.enText: to throw or drop things in different directions so that they cover an area of ground
Scatter the grass seed over the lawn.
Scatter the lawn with grass seed.

data.chText: 他们把他的骨灰撒向大海。
data.enText: They scattered his ashes at sea.
to move or to make people or animals move very quickly in different directions

data.chText: 枪声一响，人群便逃散了。
data.enText: At the first gunshot, the crowd scattered.

data.chText: 爆炸声把栖息在树丛中的鸟群惊散了。
data.enText: The explosion scattered a flock of birds roosting in the trees.

data.chText: 散落；三三两两；零零星星
data.enText: a small amount or number of things spread over an area

tr: a haphazard distribution in all directions

example: He scattered gun powder under the wagon
The children scattered in all directions when the teacher approached

tr: to cause to separate and go in different directions
example: She waved her hand and scattered the crowds

tr: strew or distribute over an area
example: He spread fertilizer over the lawn

value.def: If you scatter things over an area, you throw or drop them so that they spread all over the area.

example.ex: She tore the rose apart and scattered the petals over the grave...
example.tran: 她掰开玫瑰花，将花瓣撒在坟墓上。
他们总是把玩具扔得到处都是。

example.ex: He began by scattering seed and putting in plants.

value.def: If a group of people scatter or if you scatter them, they suddenly separate and move in different directions.

example.ex: The cavalry scattered them and chased them off the field.
example.tran: 骑兵驱散了他们并把他们逐出了战场。

value.tran: (使)(人群)分散;(使)散布在各处;(使)散开

value.def: A scatter of things is a number of them spread over an area in an irregular way.

example.ex: On the table was a pile of books and a scatter of papers.
example.tran: 桌子上放着一摞书和零落的几份报纸。

trans: (表示两个变量关系的)点聚图，散布图
